title: Schedule 3 to the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 (No. 26 of 2005),
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 10) (Income Disregard) 
Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2021 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2021. 

Commencement
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited social welfare (consolidated claim payment control) (amendment) (no 10) (income disregard) regulation 2021 (2) regulation social welfare (consolidated claim payment control) regulation 2007 2021 shall construed together one may cited together social welfare (consolidated claim payment control) regulation 2007 2021 commencement

title: Schedule 3 to the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 (No. 26 of 2005),
heading: 2. These Regulations shall have effect from 1st September 2020.
text_raw:
2. These Regulations shall have effect from 1st September 2020. 

Definitions

title: Schedule 3 to the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 (No. 26 of 2005),
heading: 3. Article 3 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and
text_raw:
3. Article 3 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and 
Control) Regulations 2007 (S. I. No. 142 of 2007) is amended by the insertion 
of the following definitions: 

“‘national framework of qualifications’ means the framework of qualifications 
established and maintained pursuant to section 7 of the Qualifications 
(Education and Training) Act 1999 (No. 26 of 1999); 

‘postgraduate course’ means , for the purpose of Article 155 (db), a course 
leading to a major higher education and training award at Level 10 (Doctoral 
Degree) on the national framework of qualifications, or equivalent awards;”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 16th March, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [109] 3 

Disregard of certain income
text_norm: 3 article 3 social welfare (consolidated claim payment control) regulation 2007 (s i no 142 2007) amended insertion following definition national framework qualification mean framework qualification established maintained pursuant section 7 qualification (education training) act 1999 (no 26 1999) postgraduate course mean purpose article 155 (db) course leading major higher education training award level 10 (doctoral degree) national framework qualification equivalent award  notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 16th march 2021 109 3 disregard certain income

title: Schedule 3 to the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 (No. 26 of 2005),
heading: 4. Article 155 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and
text_raw:
4. Article 155 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and 
Control) Regulations 2007 (S. I. No. 142 of 2007) is amended by the insertion 
of the following paragraph after paragraph (da): 

“(db) in so far as it relates to a claim for disability allowance, any amount 
awarded as bursaries, stipends or scholarships to a maximum of €20,000 per 
annum (and for not more than four years) by an approved institution as listed in 
Schedule 1 and Schedule 2 of Student Support Regulations 2020 (S.I. 77 of 
2020) for the purpose of completing a Level 10 postgraduate course (Doctoral 
Degree) within the national framework of qualifications,”. 

The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the foregoing 
Regulations. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

11 March, 2021. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

11 March, 2021. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [109]

title: Schedule 3 to the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 (No. 26 of 2005),
heading: (This note is not intended as a legal interpretation)
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not intended as a legal interpretation) 

In relation to Disability Allowance, this allows a disregard for income from a 
bursary, scholarship or stipend toward a doctoral degree. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [109] 5
